meanings.definition: Not honorable in character or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The man's ignoble actions brought shame to his family.
meanings.sent2: It is ignoble to cheat in a competition.
meanings.sent3: The ignoble behavior of the squirrel stealing nuts made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her ignoble intentions were like a dark cloud hanging over the event.
meanings.sent5: The ignoble deed was etched in everyone's memory.

meanings.definition: Not of noble birth or rank.
meanings.sent1: The ignoble peasant worked hard in the fields.
meanings.sent2: She was born into an ignoble family but rose to greatness.
meanings.sent3: The ignoble origins of the hero added an unexpected twist to the story.
meanings.sent4: His ignoble lineage did not define his future success.
meanings.sent5: Despite his ignoble background, he became a respected leader.

meanings.sent1: It was an ignoble act to spread false rumors about her.
meanings.sent2: The ignoble thief was caught red-handed.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ignoble attempt to steal the fish was foiled by a clever dog.
meanings.sent4: His ignoble behavior tarnished his reputation irreparably.
meanings.sent5: The ignoble scheme unraveled before it could cause harm.
